text:
Welcome to HowToCookThat I'm Ann Reardon and
this is Dave and today we're doing Clever

or Never, where we test a bunch of gadgets
to see *bang* if they're any good.

And you can vote in the comments as to whether
they are clever or never.

So today I have got 3 gadgets, Dave you have
3 gadgets ... your first gadget is...
A Fixie pizza cutter!
A bicycle.

Okay it's getting thumbs up for cute so far,
let's see if it actually works.
Yep, thumbs up for cute.

Here we go, do you use both wheels or just
one?
I image you use both.
It's not turning!
It is.
It's just pushing its way through the pizza.
No, it's very very good.
I like it.
It seriously didn't turn.
No it did.
Watch this.
Ok, but then it stopped turning.
It started turning, then it stopped turning.
No, it's awesome.

That is great, that is Tour de France sort
of stuff.
But it did cut the pizza.

I think this gadget is wheely good (dad jokes
ðŸ˜‚)

Vote is Clever or Never in the comments and
let us know.
Ultimate.
Gadget Number 2 is a microwave s'mores maker.

Do you remember when we were in the US and
we went to Preston's house for dinner and

his wife couldn't believe that we have never
had s'mores before so she said that's it,
after dinner we are going to have s'mores.

And then the kids were all playing bouncing
on the trampoline in the backyard and do you
remember what happened next?
Someone broke their arm!

Her son ran inside and said Mom I think I've
broken my arm.

As a mum you hear that sort of thing all the
time so she did what all mums do and said:
"I'm sure it's fine, I'll give you some ice."
And he goes: "But Mom when I go like this!"

*horror movie*
And there's this big bit sticking up where

his bone was completely broken through underneath,
so Plan B was hospital not s'mores!
So to this day we have still never had s'mores!
It's true.

The instructions on this weird gadget say
to open this up and pour in some cold water.

So I'm not quite sure what the purpose of
the cold water is.
Then you have to put a cracker here.
On top of your cracker, a piece of chocolate.
Okay.
You need to do your side.
Then a marshmallow.
Pink?
Anything it's your side.
Then another cracker.

And then you put the little hands on top to
hold it in place so that it doesn't fall off.
Give it a little squash down.
Now it says to microwave that for 30 seconds.
Okay.
Here we go.

It worked really well, I think to do a true
test though we need to compare what happens
if we just put it on a plate in the microwave.

If we get to eat another one, that's a good
idea.
Cracker, chocolate, marshmallow, cracker.
Amazing.
30 seconds in the microwave.
I'll be back.

*snap*
Ummm ... yep.
It doesn't quite look as good.
No it really doesn't.

It kinda fell off the top as the marshmallow
blew up but even I put it back on top, there's
still marshmallow everywhere.
And the cracker is really soggy underneath.
They've got this gadget worked out!
That's a good gadget.
It's cute too.

Thumbs up from me, let me know in the comments
Clever or Never.
Gadget Number 3 is a pineapple corer and spiralizer!

And what I have is I've actually got one made
out of steel here, a little bit more expensive,

and I've got this one here that's a bit of
a cheaper option made out of plastic.

We might even have a bit of a race and we'll
compare the 2.
Ready?
No ... what do we even do?
It's your gadget!
It's like a salt and pepper shaker.

I'm assuming that we push it and turn it with
the handle.
Are you ready?
On your marks, get set, go!
Oh gosh, I don't think I can even get it in.
Oh I'm gonna break this again.
I'm off!
I can't get it in.
Oh I could lose a finger here!
No, this is awesome.
I'm getting splashed with pineapple juice.

That's right we're racing aren't we, I'm going
heaps fast.
I've never won a race against you in the kitchen.

I think mine is going to break, I'm going
to hold it.
I'm not winning, as in it's not working.
Oh dear!
Mine just came off.

The gadget is still there but the pineapple
bit didn't work.
Ok let me try again.
Mine is looking fantastic.

Yours is all the way in and mine is not even
started.
I don't know, I reckon I'm through.
You have to pull it back out don't you?

Watch this, watch this ...
Woooooow!

Oh that's beautiful, oh my goodness how do
you get it off?
Do you just take the handle bit off.
No it's like a kebab, you just eat it.

That is awesome and look at that, if you hadn't
gone all the way through to the bottom you

could use that and fill it with fruit salad
or something like that.

That is actually a great idea, I think I'm
going to do that.
Look at this, it's a pineapple spiral.

I'm impressed because normally if you cut
all of the outside off and then you cut all
the eyes out it takes ages to cut up a pineapple.
Pineapple accordian.
That's very cool.
You try mine, you might just have 'the knack'.
Yours seems to be making crushed pineapple.

That's definitely mashing it, not spiralizing
it.
Not good.

If you look at that, it's not a proper saw
blade.

That's a zig zag, it's always going to mash
it.

Whereas this one is actually on the right
angle to cut the pineapple.
I think it's going to pour our the bottom.
Okay.
Nope.
Awesome.
Look at that, oh my goodness!

So for all your summer needs, all you need
is a pineapple, a corer, an orange and a little
umbrella.

Delightful *eye poking sounds*
And possibly a straw too.
Gadget Number 4 is a battle of the Cake Levellers.

There's a whole array of gadgets you can use
to level your cake, so starting with ones

that are like 99c through to ones that are
like $25.
So there's a big discrepancy in price there.

These ones are a pretty nifty idea.They attach
onto the knife blade, put this one on the
same level.

You put this down flat on the bench so that
each side is flat, and then you cut through

the cake like this and you get a nice, even
layer.

Look at that, a perfect level nice layer of
cake.

Can you think of an obvious way that this
might not work, what's a disadvantage of this
one?
If you don't have cake?

What's the other thing that you may not have
that would make this not work?
A wife who knows how to do it?

Can you not think of the other thing that
you might need?

*crickets*
No.
A knife?

A knife that is super long, so the knife blade
has to be longer than the width of your cake
in order for this to work.

If you have a super long knife, you can just
pay the cheap amount and get that and it actually

does work very well to give you nice, even
layers of cake.
The second cake leveller is this one.

This one is essentially very similar to this,
except this one has a serated knife blade
and this just has 2 wires.

The wires are bending but it is going through,
even though they are bending and struggling.
Let's have a look.
We have 1, 2, 3 layers.

The third cake cutter is this weird looking
thing.

So basically you're supposed make it bigger
or smaller.
I like this one, it's very aesthetically pleasing.

And then you choose your layer level, let's
choose this one.

And cut but then you get to here and you can't
cut anymore because we are stuck.

Open it up, turn it around the other side,
close it again.
Remember which groove you were in.
Try again.
It's a bit uneven.
It's thinner there and thicker there.
I am sorry but not this one.

Do you reckon you could level using the big
one?
It looks a little bit dangerous almost.

If somebody came down a dark alley with that
you'd probably run.

Now let's look at these other layers, we've
got 1, it's looking pretty good, 2.
That's good.
That one worked really well.

If you're an everyday bro (*groan) cake maker
then maybe this one.

You've also got to consider where you're going
to store that.

And if you're the occasional baker and you've
got a long knife then that one.

Gadget Number 5 is your gadget, I don't know
what it is but you asked for something that

had to be stirred when it was cooking so I've
just got in here some milk, custard powder

and sugar because you have to stir custard
continually or it will go lumpy ... so what's
your gadget?
My gadget is a stirrer!
Because a spoon is just too much hard work.
This is a stirrer.
Yeah, no but look at this, it's like 2017.

Let's see if we end up with lumpy custard
or smooth custard.

Oh look it is moving now that it's in the
liquid.
And now it's stopped.
It's not doing anything.

Let me just give it a help, maybe it needs
to get started, I'll give it a bit of a stir
and then let go.

So maybe it's like an automatic stirrer that
you have to do manually?

This is awful, this is the worst gadget we've
ever tested.

Look it's completely caught on the bottom
and look at all those lumps.
Awww that is delicious!
Who likes lumpy custard right?
It did the worst job ever.

This is a Never ... I'm declaring it, don't
care what you write in the comments, this
one is a Never.
Unless you like lumpy custard!

Gadget Number 6 is a Cupcake Maker for making
a single cake in the microwave.

I actually thought, when I got this, that
there's no way this would be better than just

using a plain cup but the s'mores maker proved
that it was actually very good, so this could
be amazing.

Then pour the rest into the cup and we will
see which one bakes.

Now it says, it's got very varying baking
times.

It says if your microwave is 700 Watts then
3 minutes, if it's 1000 Watts, 1 minute.
So we'll go for 1 minute and see how we go.
Shall we start with this one, it has a lid.
Aha look at that.
Do you think it will be the shape?
Oh, out the top.
Oh my goodness, look at that, it's squirting.
It's still got 10 seconds to go...
Woah!

*Bang*
Ohhhh, it was looking so promising, oh no,
what a mess!
All was looking good until the final seconds.
Let's try this one for 1 minute.
It's looking OK.
Hmmm, it's a bit eggy.

I think it needs cocoa powder in there, I
don't think it's the best recipe or the best
gadget.

So this is take number 2 on the cupcake maker,
this time I let it cook and I let the cake

come all the way to the top and then I quickly
turned it off so it didn't explode.
So let's have a look inside...
Ugh, interesting looking.
Is it pudding or cake?
It's supposed to be cake.
Shall I tip it out.

Oh it's not cooked, look it's still uncooked
on the bottom.
So you've either got to have uncooked or exploded.

I think the cup is the safer bet because it
doesn't explode all over the microwave and
it tastes pretty much the same.

I think for entertainment value, exploding
all over the microwave was much more fun.

Clever if you're wanting to surprise the kids
with an exploding cupcake, other than that
Never.

Let us know if there's any other gadgets that
you'd like us to test out and review for you,

put them in the comments below, Make it a
Great Week and we'll see you on Friday.
Bye.
